alert.note: Alert for St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued December 13 at 3:13PM AKST until December 14 at 6:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AKST TUESDAY... ...BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM TUESDAY TO MIDNIGHT AKST WEDNESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills to 45 below occuring. The cold wind chills will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin. Blizzard conditions expected starting Tuesday evening, with winds gusting to 70 mph and 4 to 8 inches of snow. * WHERE...Bering Strait Coast. * WHEN...For the Blizzard Warning, 6 PM Tuesday to midnight Wednesday night. For the Wind Chill Advisory, now to 6 PM Tuesday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Winds gusting as high as 70 mph will cause whiteout conditions in blowing snow starting Tuesday evening . Significant drifting of the snow is likely. The cold wind chills will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel extremely difficult. A Wind Chill Advisory means that cold air and sustained wind speeds of 15 mph or more will create low wind chills. Frost bite and hypothermia can occur if precautions are not taken.

area.areaDesc: St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast
